Small Magellanic Cloud.Notes: The smaller of two naked eye dwarf galaxies that orbit the Milky Way. It can be seen from the Southern Hemisphere. There is also a high population of X-ray Binaries.
captions: This image shows the entire Large Magellanic Cloud, with some of the brightest objects marked. The field of the new MPG/ESO 2.2-metre telescope image is indicated with an outline. The field of view is about ten degrees across.
Small and Large Magellanic Clouds over Paranal Observatory
DEM L316A is located some 160,000 light-years away in the Large Magellanic Cloud
NGC 1783 is one of the biggest globular clusters in the Large Magellanic Cloud
Small part of the Large Magellanic Cloud
